title: Biblical Foundations I
subtitle: Covenant Structure in Scripture
description: A structured theology course examining Scripture as unified narrative organized around covenant. Students will identify major covenants structuring biblical narrative, explain the relationship between Old and New Testament, describe basic genre categories and their reading strategies, trace key theological themes across Scripture, and apply the historical-grammatical method to selected passages.
learning_outcomes: Identify major covenants structuring biblical narrative
Explain the relationship between Old and New Testament
Describe basic genre categories and their reading strategies
Trace key theological themes across Scripture
Apply historical-grammatical method to selected passages

units.title: Introduction to Biblical Study
units.description: Canon formation, genre categories, reading strategy

units.title: Exodus and Law
units.description: Sinai covenant, legal literature, tabernacle theology

units.title: Land and Kingship
units.description: Joshua-Judges cycle, Davidic covenant, prophetic critique

units.title: Exile and Restoration
units.description: Prophetic response, return themes, canon closure

instructional_approach.session_structure: 7-segment lesson flow (orientation, reading, context, analysis, themes, question, close)
instructional_approach.knowledge_assessment: factual recall questions at lesson end

questions: What are the three elements of the Abrahamic covenant promise?
What literary form does the Sinai covenant follow?
What is the primary function of the tabernacle in Exodus?
What dynasty does the Davidic covenant establish?
What does Jeremiah 31 promise regarding a new covenant?

next_course.title: Hermeneutics I
next_course.description: Apply historical-grammatical method systematically to develop skills for independent biblical study
